body: How did those `folder 1` and `folder 2` get created?  s3 doesn't have a concept of empty folders, so I suspect they are actually 0 size objects with a trailing /.  Rclone doesn't deal brilliantly with these...  The ERROR messages are rclone ignoring those objects and it looks like the sync worked properly.

issue.title: Entry doesn't belong in directory - Capitalization Issue

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
### System Info:
`rclone -V`: 
    
     rclone v1.37-024-g1ecf2bcbβ
`uname -a` (dockerized):

     Linux cfa773f6935a 4.4.52+ #1 SMP Thu Jun 15 15:23:01 PDT 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

`lsb_release -a`:
    
    Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
    Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
    Release:	16.04
    Codename:	xenial

### Issue

The command I am trying to run (sync a Dropbox folder)

       rclone -vv --fast-list    --bwlimit 30M --tpslimit 10.0  --config /code/rclone.config sync  dropbox:/ /backups/dropbox/


I see the following Log output:

      2017/07/26 07:46:50 ERROR : Some Example/03_for_example/zip-files/20170725.zip: Entry doesn't belong in directory "Some Example/03_For_Example/zip-files" (too short) - ignoring

It looks like Dropbox is having issues with capitalization.

Best,
Martin

body: All of the bucket based remotes potentially have this problem - objects with names ending in `/` which have been uploaded by other storage systems (cyberduck for instance).

In answer to your Q, at that time I created those directories using the
webinterface of S3.

On 21 December 2017 at 10:39, Nick Craig-Wood <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> All of the bucket based remotes potentially have this problem - objects
> with names ending in / which have been uploaded by other storage systems
> (cyberduck for instance).
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1621#issuecomment-353304705>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AI2kFV5pTMxDzCZY67hXJOzPW-zEQR13ks5tCidQgaJpZM4PBBoE>
> .
>

I'm also having the issue that a lot of `ERROR :  *NAME* Entry doesn't belong in directory "*DIRNAME*" (same as directory) - ignoring` are getting spammed. 

This applies to the `ls` and the `copy` command (only tested those two).

The `copy` did result in a correct result and ultimately worked as expected, only with error-statements printed during the process.

### Directory structure on S3 ###
```
└── 1
    ├──  8
    │   └── 5
    │       └── 5
    │           └── 855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22
    │           └── 855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22_BACK
    └── b
        └── 7
            └── 2
                └── b72ebb861a3e4c3c6fce1022026ba767900d347ff6600b9266006d59805b0ec9
```

### List Output ###
```
$ rclone ls s3-test:mybucket/1/
2018/01/12 11:00:48 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 11:00:48 ERROR : b/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 11:00:49 ERROR : 8/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 11:00:49 ERROR : b/7/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 11:00:49 ERROR : b/7/2/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7/2" (same as directory) - ignoring
       81 b/7/2/b72ebb861a3e4c3c6fce1022026ba767900d347ff6600b9266006d59805b0ec9
2018/01/12 11:00:49 ERROR : 8/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 11:00:49 ERROR : 8/5/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
   176214 8/5/5/855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22
   568586 8/5/5/855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22_BACK

```


```
$ rclone ls s3-test:mybucket/1/ -vvvvvvv
2018/01/12 10:43:50 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/******/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/01/12 10:43:50 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" " s3-test:mybucket/1/" "-vvvvvvv"]
2018/01/12 10:43:50 INFO  : S3 bucket mybucket path 1/: Modify window is 1ns
2018/01/12 10:43:50 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:43:51 ERROR : b/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:43:51 ERROR : 8/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:43:51 ERROR : b/7/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:43:51 ERROR : 8/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:43:51 ERROR : b/7/2/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7/2" (same as directory) - ignoring
       81 b/7/2/b72ebb861a3e4c3c6fce1022026ba767900d347ff6600b9266006d59805b0ec9
2018/01/12 10:43:51 ERROR : 8/5/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
   176214 8/5/5/855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22
   568586 8/5/5/855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22_BACK
2018/01/12 10:43:51 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 11
2018/01/12 10:43:51 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "s3-test:mybucket/1/" "-vvvvvvv"]
```

### Copying ###

```
$ rclone copy s3-test:mybucket/1 . 
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : b/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : 8/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : b/7/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : 8/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : b/7/2/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7/2" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:54:54 ERROR : 8/5/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5/5" (same as directory) - ignoring

```


```
$ rclone copy s3-test:mybucket/1 . -vvvvvvv
Enter configuration password:
password:
2018/01/12 10:48:36 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/*****/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/01/12 10:48:36 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "s3-test:mybucket/1" "." "-vvvvvvv"]
2018/01/12 10:48:36 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/rclonetest: Modify window is 1ns
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : 8/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : b/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : 8/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : b/7/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : 8/5/5/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "8/5/5" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 ERROR : b/7/2/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/7/2" (same as directory) - ignoring
2018/01/12 10:48:36 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/rclonetest: Waiting for checks to finish
2018/01/12 10:48:36 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/rclonetest: Waiting for transfers to finish
2018/01/12 10:48:37 INFO  : b/7/2/b72ebb861a3e4c3c6fce1022026ba767900d347ff6600b9266006d59805b0ec9: Copied (new)
2018/01/12 10:48:37 INFO  : 8/5/5/855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22: Copied (new)
2018/01/12 10:48:37 INFO  : 8/5/5/855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22_BACK: Copied (new)
2018/01/12 10:48:37 INFO  : 
Transferred:   727.423 kBytes (160.820 kBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            3
Elapsed time:        4.5s

2018/01/12 10:48:37 DEBUG : Go routines at exit 11
2018/01/12 10:48:37 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "s3-test:mybucket/1" "." "-vvvvvvv"]
```

#### Resulting filetree locally after copy-command ####
```
$ tree
.
├── 8
│   └── 5
│       └── 5
│           ├── 855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22
│           └── 855f16acf2260d710c22a702fa8587c5d8bfbc22_BACK
└── b
    └── 7
        └── 2
            └── b72ebb861a3e4c3c6fce1022026ba767900d347ff6600b9266006d59805b0ec9
```

I get these errors as well, but the copy seems to go ok. Any idea what the root cause is?

I also get "can't overwrite file with directory"

> I get these errors as well, but the copy seems to go ok. Any idea what the root cause is?

The cause is 0 sizes objects called `directory/` which some tools make to mark directories.  This confuses rclone somewhat!

I haven't figured out a sensible work-around yet though.

I've fixed this now by ignoring these files

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.40-006-gf6020f13/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Please re-open if you have a problem with the fix.

issue.title: s3: Support empty "directory" keys

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Many tools like the the AWS S3 Console, S3 network drives / fuse filesystems and various other tools create "directories" on S3 by creating zero byte keys that end with a slash to emulate empty directories.

rclone currently can't handle these keys, because it tries to treat them like a file instead of a directory and fails with an error if a local directory with the same name exist.

Instead rclone should detect these keys and treat them like a directory.

The keys are easy to detect, because they always end with a slash and have a content-length of 0 bytes.

Here's an example key listed with the python aws cli:

```
aws s3api head-object --bucket bito-pim-images --key 'images/WebShop/ita_IT/'
{
    "AcceptRanges": "bytes",
    "ContentType": "binary/octet-stream",
    "LastModified": "Fri, 22 Jul 2016 12:32:11 GMT",
    "ContentLength": 0,
    "ETag": "\"d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e\"",
    "Metadata": {}
}
```

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

v1.33-DEV

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

macOS 10.12.1

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

s3

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone sync --size-only --delete-after remote:tmp /tmp`

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2016/09/30 22:09:55 Local file system at /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images: Waiting for transfers to finish
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/ita_IT/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/ita_IT: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/nld_BE/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/nld_BE: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/nld_NL/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/nld_NL: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/pol_PL/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/pol_PL: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 images/WebShop/slo_SK/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/slo_SK: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 images/WebShop/spa_ES/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/spa_ES: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 images/WebShop/ukrainian_ukraine/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/ukrainian_ukraine: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 Local file system at /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2016/09/30 22:09:56 Attempt 3/3 failed with 30 errors and: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2016/09/30 22:09:56 Failed to sync: not deleting files as there were IO errors
```

It's very easy to create a test key by going into the AWS S3 Console and clicking on "Create Folder" to create an empty directory.

body:
I see this with azureblobs on version 1.44 when i have wierd object names.

2018/11/21 07:48:05 ERROR : AQMkAGQ4N2ZkZjBmLTljZTAtNDE5OQAtODNiOC1iZDJiNzA3OTc0YzYARgAAA7rox93WMGFHjb9sdy9Q8KkHAASMLmNTUCZMiMkFF5gUyS8AAAIBCgAAAASMLmNTUCZMiMkFF5gUyS8AAAKWiwAAAAESABAA2nkLEa: Entry doesn't belong in directory "AQMkAGQ4N2ZkZjBmLTljZTAtNDE5OQAtODNiOC1iZDJiNzA3OTc0YzYARgAAA7rox93WMGFHjb9sdy9Q8KkHAASMLmNTUCZMiMkFF5gUyS8AAAIBCgAAAASMLmNTUCZMiMkFF5gUyS8AAAKWiwAAAAESABAA2nkLEa" (too short) - ignoring

@drankard can you try with [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) and if you still have the problem then please make a [new issue on github](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/new) with a log and if you can a way I can reproduce it - thank you :-)
I'm running into this now with 1.54.1 :(

> I've fixed this now by ignoring these files

Did you make this specific to S3? Because I'm seeing this now with a Backblaze/B2 storage. If you'd expect the fix to work on B2, and it's not, I'll open another issue.
@detly probably best to  [post on the rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/) about this first then we can decide if we need a new issue.

I am seeing this same issue with rclone and s3 like below. Is there any update to fix this?

 ERROR : userfiles/images/: Entry doesn't belong in directory "userfiles/images" (same as directory) - ignoring
@naveenksamala this ERROR is harmless. It probably means you have a non-zero sized directory marker.
